application.name: mergekeys
application.description: merges two sorted flat files with some different columns

option.name: delim
option.description: delimiting string for both input files

application.example: # merges impressions and clicks from the db for a given site with the # conversion numbers from data transfer # file delimiter d=`tochar 0xfe` # create headers for db results, using the dt-style header for Site-ID echo "Site-ID${d}Impressions${d}Clicks" > $wdir/tmp/site_delivery.log DB_DSN=$SPUR_DSN dbstream -s \ "select site_id, sum(metric_a), sum(metric_b) \ from dfa_performance \ where advertiser_id = 123456 \ and event_date = '01-JAN-29' \ and event_type_id = 1 \ group by site_id \ order by site_id" \ >> $wdir/tmp/site_delivery.log # assume Site-ID is field 8, Quantity is field 12 gzdog $dt_dir/Activity_123456_01-01-2029.log.gz | aggregate -p -k 8 -s 12 > $wdir/tmp/dt_conversions.log mergekeys -o $wdir/tmp/imps_clicks_conversions.log $wdir/tmp/site_delivery.log $wdir/tmp/dt_conversions.log # $wdir/tmp/imps_clicks_conversions.log now contains fields # Site-ID # Impressions # Clicks # Quantity
